movementModel

Class MovementModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • movementModel.MovementModel

  • public class MovementModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Movementmodel contains the modelling information for transforming the AltitudeMap to a movement-modelled graph.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MovementModel(double mapCellSize)
      Constructor with no parameters sets default values for the uphill and downhill speed factors and the given map cell size.
      MovementModel(double speedFactorUphillSteep, double speedFactorUphill, double speedFactorDownhill, double speedFactorDownhillSteep, double mapCellSize, double basicSpeed, double impassableEdgeWeight)
      Constructor with parameters creates a MovementModel with the given parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calculateEdgeWeight(double altitudeChange)
      Returns the edge weight that corresponds to the movement model and the altitudechange given as the parameter.
      double getBasicSpeed()
      Returns the basic speed, in rough equivalent of meters per second
      double getImpassableEdgeWeight()
      Return the edge weight of impassable edges (steepness lessThan -1.5 or greaterThan 1.5)
      double getMapCellSize()
      Returns the map cell size in meters
      double getSpeedFactorDownhill()
      Returns the speedfactor of downhill (-0.7 lessThanOrEqual steepness lessThan -0.1)
      double getSpeedFactorDownhillSteep()
      Returns the speedfactor of steep downhill (-1.5 lessThanOrEqual steepness lessThan -0.7)
      double getSpeedFactorUphill()
      Returns the speedfactor of uphill (0.1 lessThanOrEqual steepness lessThan 0.7)
      double getSpeedFactorUphillSteep()
      Returns the speedfactor of steep uphill (0.7 lessThanOrEqual steepness lessThanOrEqual 1.5)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MovementModel

        public MovementModel(double mapCellSize)
        Constructor with no parameters sets default values for the uphill and downhill speed factors and the given map cell size. The basic speed is set to 2.0 (a rough equivalent of meters per second).
        Parameters:
        mapCellSize - The map cell size in meters

      • MovementModel

        public MovementModel(double speedFactorUphillSteep,
                     double speedFactorUphill,
                     double speedFactorDownhill,
                     double speedFactorDownhillSteep,
                     double mapCellSize,
                     double basicSpeed,
                     double impassableEdgeWeight)
        Constructor with parameters creates a MovementModel with the given parameters. Steepness = altitudeChange / mapCellSize. Steepness of over 1.5 or under -1.5 is inpassable. Speedfactor of -0.1 lessThan steepness lessThanOrEqual 0.1 is considered flat and given an speedfactor 1.0. NOTE: All speedfactors must be lessThanOrEqual 1 for goal-estimating algorithms' heuristics to be admissible!
        Parameters:
        speedFactorUphillSteep - Speedfactor of steep uphill (0.7 lessThanOrEqual steepness lessThanOrEqual 1.5)
        speedFactorUphill - Speedfactor of uphill (0.1 lessThanOrEqual steepness lessThan 0.7)
        speedFactorDownhill - Speedfactor of downhill (-0.7 lessThanOrEqual steepness lessThan -0.1)
        speedFactorDownhillSteep - Speedfactor of steep downhill (-1.5 lessThanOrEqual steepness lessThan -0.7)
        mapCellSize - Map cell size in meters
        basicSpeed - Basic speed, rough equivalent of meters per second
        impassableEdgeWeight - The impassable steepness edge weight, e.g. Double.MAX_VALUE

    • Method Detail

        public double getSpeedFactorUphillSteep()
        Returns the speedfactor of steep uphill (0.7 lessThanOrEqual steepness lessThanOrEqual 1.5)

      • calculateEdgeWeight

        public double calculateEdgeWeight(double altitudeChange)
        Returns the edge weight that corresponds to the movement model and the altitudechange given as the parameter.
        Parameters:
        altitudeChange - The altitude change for which edge weight is to be calculated
        Returns:
        double The calculated edge weight (rough equivalent of meters/sec)
